verbs.description: croodle (third-person singular simple present croodles, present participle croodling, simple past and past participle croodled)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, obsolete) To cower or cuddle together, as from fear or cold; to lie close and snug together, as pigs in straw.
examples: Oh! that I had wings-not as a dove , to fly home to its nest and croodle there

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, obsolete) To fawn or coax.
Such a bird vocalisation, especially that given by doves.

verbs.description: croodle (third-person singular simple present croodles, present participle croodling, simple past and past participle croodled)

entries.meaning: (originally Scotland, dialect) To make a cooing sound.
